com.github.dm.jrt.core.util

Class TimeDuration

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.dm.jrt.core.util.Time
      • com.github.dm.jrt.core.util.TimeDuration
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<Time>

    public class TimeDuration
extends Time
    Utility class for handling a time duration in different time units.

    Created by davide-maestroni on 09/09/2014.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description

      Interface defining a condition to check.

      • timeSinceMillis

        @NotNull
public static TimeDuration timeSinceMillis(long milliTime)
        Creates and returns an object representing the time range between now and a time in the past.
        If the specified is in the future, a ZERO duration will be returned.
        Parameters:
        milliTime - the system time in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        the time duration instance.
        See Also:
        System.currentTimeMillis()

      • timeSinceNanos

        @NotNull
public static TimeDuration timeSinceNanos(long nanoTime)
        Creates and returns an object representing the time range between now and a time in the past.
        If the specified is in the future, a ZERO duration will be returned.
        Parameters:
        nanoTime - the high precision system time in nanoseconds.
        Returns:
        the time duration instance.
        See Also:
        System.nanoTime()

      • minus

        @NotNull
public TimeDuration minus(@NotNull
                                   Time time)
        Returns a new instance whose time value is decremented by the specified one.

        Note that the unit of the returned time will match the one with the highest precision.

        Overrides:
        minus in class Time
        Parameters:
        time - the time to subtract.
        Returns:
        the time duration instance.

public TimeDuration plus(@NotNull

        public boolean isInfinity()
        Checks if this duration represents the infinity.
        Returns:

      • join

        public void join(@NotNull
                 Thread target)
          throws InterruptedException
        Performs a Thread.join() using this duration as timeout.
        Parameters:
        target - the target thread.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted.

      • sleep

        public void sleep()
           throws InterruptedException
        Performs a Thread.sleep(long, int) using this duration as timeout.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted.

      • sleepAtLeast

        public void sleepAtLeast()
                  throws InterruptedException
        Performs a Thread.sleep(long, int) using this duration as timeout, ensuring that the sleep time is respected even if spurious wake-ups happen in the while.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted.

      • sleepSinceMillis

        public boolean sleepSinceMillis(long milliTime)
                         throws InterruptedException
        Performs a Thread.sleep(long, int) as if started from the specified system time in milliseconds, by using this duration as timeout.
        Parameters:
        milliTime - the starting system time in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        whether the sleep happened at all.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this duration overflows the maximum sleep time.
        InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted.
        See Also:
        System.currentTimeMillis()

      • sleepSinceNanos

        public boolean sleepSinceNanos(long nanoTime)
                        throws InterruptedException
        Performs a Thread.sleep(long, int) as if started from the specified high precision system time in nanoseconds, by using this duration as timeout.
        Parameters:
        nanoTime - the starting system time in nanoseconds.
        Returns:
        whether the sleep happened at all.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this duration overflows the maximum sleep time.
        InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted.
        See Also:
        System.nanoTime()

      • wait

        public void wait(@NotNull
                 Object target)
          throws InterruptedException
        Performs an Object.wait() using this duration as timeout.
        Parameters:
        target - the target object.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted.

      • waitSinceMillis

        public boolean waitSinceMillis(@NotNull
                               Object target,

                        throws InterruptedException
        Performs an Object.wait() as if started from the specified system time in milliseconds, by using this duration as timeout.
        Parameters:

        milliTime - the starting system time in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        whether the wait happened at all.
        Throws:

        Parameters:

      • waitTrue

        public boolean waitTrue(@NotNull
                        Object target,
                        @NotNull
                        TimeDuration.Condition condition)
                 throws InterruptedException
        Waits for the specified condition to be true by performing an Object.wait() and using this duration as timeout.
        Parameters:
        target - the target object.
        condition - the condition to verify.
        Returns:
        whether the check became true before the timeout elapsed.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted.
